channel.title: Data Science Portfolio on Jani Tuononen
channel.description: Recent content in Data Science Portfolio on Jani Tuononen

item.title: Digit recognizer - Handwritten digits classification
item.description: The purpose of the project was to use computer vision fundamentals including simple neural networks to find out how well the model can read handwritten digits. The project dataset contained 70000 (train data 42000 & test data 28000) images of handwritten digits. Handwritten digits varied from 0 to 9. I used Keras’s Sequential model to get over 99,5% accuracy. You can see the whole project here

item.title: Titanic - Machine learning from disaster
item.description: I made a model that predicted which passengers survived from the Titanic shipwreck. Dataset had 1309 passengers and crew, 891 in training data and 418 in testing data. The Titanic had total of 2224 passengers and crew. I tried to find out correlation between surviving and sex,age etc.. I used train test split for training and testing data. From training data my best accuracy was with Decision tree classifier almost 94% right.
